intro: Chaenorhinum villosum subsp. granatense, commonly known as the Granate hairpin flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, pinkish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, which contribute to its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and can be found in wildflower meadows.
